sentence: Release the sticks and the vehicle will maintain its current attitude and will not return to level (attitude hold).
Pure rate mode stabilization, utilizing only the gyros with no attitude feedback from the accelerometers, can be forced by setting bit 1 of ACRO_OPTIONS to one.
1.The throttle is completely manual with no compensation for tilt angle of the vehicle.
If the pilot puts the throttle completely down the motors will go to their minimum rate and stabilization will cease.
2.Copter includes an Acro Trainer functionality that can be turned on/off to make learning to fly Acro easier.
3.Stick inputs are interpreted in the "body frame" (as opposed to Sport mode in which they are "earth frame").
While Acro mode does not necessarily require GPS, switching to RTL in case of emergency does.
Make sure you do have a reliable position estimate prior to arming, most commonly provided by 3D GPS fix with sufficient HDOP.
Acro mode can be setup to provide full stabilization at idle throttle.
1. 0 = disabled.
This means the pilot operates in full Rate control with no automatic leveling nor angle-limiting performed by the autopilot.
2. 1 = automatic leveling.
The vehicle will automatically return to the level when the pilot releases the sticks.
3. 2 (Default) = automatic leveling and lean angle limited.
Includes the automatic leveling as option #1 but in addition the vehicle will not lean more than 45 degrees (this angle can be configured with the ANGLE_MAX parameter).
By setting the ACRO_BAL_ROLL and ACRO_BAL_PITCH parameters to non-zero values, this feature takes effect.
This feature is not active when ACRO_TRAINER is active
1.ACRO_RP_RATE controls the rotation rate for the roll and pitch axis.
The default, 4.5, will command a 200deg/sec rotation rate.
Higher values lead to higher rotation rates, lower to slower rotation rates.
2.ACRO_Y_RATE controls the rotation rate for the yaw axis.
The default, 4.5, like roll and pitch, will command a 200deg/sec rotation rate.
3.ACRO_RP_EXPO and ACRO_Y_EXPO are an amount of Exponential to apply to the pilots stick inputs that only applies to ACRO mode.
1.ATC_ACCEL_R_MAX and ATC_ACCEL_P_MAX: Maximum acceleration in roll/pitch axis measured in Centi-degres/sec/sec.
2.ATC_ACCEL_Y_MAX: Maximum acceleration in Yaw axis measured in Centi-degress/sec/sec.
3.ATC_THR_MIX_MAN: Balance between attitude and throttle control.
This value can be increased to improve attitude control when the throttle is cut for better Airmode handling, however a stable tune is essential before it can be increased.
